Subject: (For Disasters) Disaster Relief And Recovery
Object: The American Red Cross Disaster Relief and Recovery program provides emergency aid, advice, and assistance to help those recovering from a disaster.This program provides:- Temporary shelter/housing - Mental Health Assistance- Financial Assistance- Health Services- Disaster-related assistance

Subject: (For Disasters) Disaster Relief And Recovery
Object: This program covers residents of the following counties: Imperial County, CA, Orange County, CA, Riverside County, CA, San Bernardino County, CA and San Diego County, CA.

Object: Operation SafeHouse is a 24-hour emergency shelter whose mission is to serve runaway, homeless, and at-risk youth ages 11 - 17 in Riverside County. (for heat) Cooling Center
Object: The Arlanza Community Center provides a cooling center for those who are disabled, elderly, or otherwise vulnerable to excessive heat.This program provides:- Relief from excessive heatThe cooling center generally activates when temperatures reach 100 degree F. The center generally closes during the day, but stays open continuously on days with excessive heat. Please call for more info.

Path of Life Emergency Shelter Program
Object: The Community Shelter Program is a 30-60 day emergency homeless shelter that serves adult individuals experiencing housing crises by providing an immediate exit off of the street into temporary housing along with wraparound support services.This program provides:- Temporary shelterShelter guests are also provided with:- Assistance in obtaining important documents- Job readiness training- Housing referrals- Computer workshops- Counseling- Nutritious meals- Hygiene supplies- Showers- Social, spiritual, and emotional support- Case managementIntakes are conducted daily from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. based on bed availability. Please call to schedule an appointment.

Norton Younglove Community Center Cool/Warm Center
Object: When the temperature climbs, Norton Younglove Community Center springs into action as a designated “Cool Center.” From June 1st to October 15th, we welcome vulnerable individuals, seniors, the disabled, and anyone seeking temporary relief from the scorching heat. Our air-conditioned facility provides a safe haven where you can beat the heat and stay comfortable. Remember, your well-being matters to us! Stay hydrated, take breaks, and enjoy the cool respite with us.🌞🏢🌟
